PaperTitle: Uncertainty-aware visual analytics for exploring human behaviors from heterogeneous spatial temporal data

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Loads raster tourist map and vector road network of Abila from the IEEE VAST Challenge 2014 dataset.
Outputs: Georeferenced map and road network layers
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1: '...a raster format tourist map of Abila, a vector format road network and a name list of the employees.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Loads GPS logs of employee car trajectories and transaction logs from IEEE VAST Challenge 2014 dataset.
Inputs: GPS logs (685,171 records at one-second resolution)
Transaction logs (loyalty card and credit card records)
Outputs: Time-stamped trajectory data and enriched transactional event data
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.1: 'The GPS log and transaction datasets cover 54 employees and a time span of two weeks, Jan. 6â€“19.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Defines events from GPS logs as stops above 1 minute, enriched with POI and transaction information.
Outputs: Event data structure with time span, location, car, and transaction attributes
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 4.2: 'The events are first defined from the GPS logs, as stops above 1 min... enriched with POIs and transaction information.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Refines manually extracted POI boundaries using GPS data and transaction logs to improve spatial accuracy.
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.1.2: 'We use GPS and transaction log information as the reference to refine the boundaries (Fig. 4).'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Improves temporal resolution of loyalty card data by matching it with high-resolution credit card transactions.
Outputs: Refined timestamp for loyalty card transactions
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.2.1: 'We match the transactions in the same day with identical location, price, person.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Detects and corrects systematic location shifts in GPS trajectories using general visiting patterns.
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.4.2: 'We calculate the shift of frequent visiting places from the regular patterns and shift the uncertain data back (Algorithm 5).'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Matches vehicle GPS movement with transaction data to infer missing driver identities.
Outputs: Assigned identities to vehicles without driver info
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.5: 'We visually map the stop event and transaction events in the event view (Fig. 9)... we successfully find the car assignment for these nine drivers and five cars.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays positions of POIs, GPS tracks, and allows spatial filtering in a 2D map view.
Outputs: Interactive 2D spatial visualization with spatial filtering capabilities
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.1: 'Map view shows the positions of POIs and GPS tracks (Fig. 9a)... Users can apply spatial filters on the map to select GPS tracks passing single or multiple regions.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Overlays POI categories, GPS routes, and outlier highlights on the 2D map view.
Outputs: Color-coded overlays on the 2D map highlighting POI categories and anomalies
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.1: 'Each POI is represented by a polygon, with color encoding the POI categories.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays temporal distribution of GPS records and supports temporal filtering.
Outputs: Interactive timeline view showing temporal data distribution
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.1: 'Timeline view shows the temporal distribution of GPS records (Fig. 9b)... Users can apply temporal filters on the timeline to select GPS tracks within single or multiple time ranges.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Visualizes enriched event sequences of multiple employees, supporting behavior comparison and correlation analysis.
Outputs: Timeline view comparing multiple employees' behaviors
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.2: 'Event timeline shows the event subsequence in the selected time range for multiple employees (Fig. 9e).'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Displays a tabular list of employee names, car assignments, event counts, and transaction summaries for quick selection and analysis.
Outputs: Interactive table with employee behavior summaries and filtering options
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.2: 'Entity view shows a name list of the employees (Fig. 9c). Users can directly select people on the list.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to filter GPS tracks and events by selecting spatial regions on the map view.
Outputs: Filtered GPS tracks and event data
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.1: 'Users can apply spatial filters on the map to select GPS tracks passing single or multiple regions.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to filter events and movements by time range using the timeline view.
Outputs: Filtered events in timeline and map views
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 6.1: 'Users can apply temporal filters on the timeline to select GPS tracks within single or multiple time ranges.'

GranularBlocks.PaperDescription: Allows users to define, edit, and color-code POI categories and update boundary settings in the visual interface.
Outputs: Updated POI categories and visual overlays on the map
GranularBlocks.ReferenceCitation: Section 5.1.1: 'We summarized the POIs to different function categories. The categories include GAStech (work place), restaurant, shop, home, etc. Then we assign a color for each POI category.
